title: Teacher Perspective Transformation Program Based on Lesson Study for Improving Mathematics Teaching and Learning: Applying Social Collaborative Learning Models

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive professional field experience, basic understanding of social interaction and collaborative learning environments
context.additional_context: The program focuses on pre-service teachers acquiring new perspectives in mathematics education through lesson study and enhancing their competency in designing learner-centered instruction, with a particular emphasis on educational design reflecting sociocultural constructivist theory and cultural contexts.

learning_goals: Learners participate in three or more lesson study cycles during a six-month course, write three reflective journals comparing traditional approaches (e.g., lecture-based instruction, teacher-centered explanations) with alternative methods (e.g., collaborative learning, inquiry-based learning, social interaction enhancement strategies) in math lesson design, and derive at least two improvement plans through peer evaluation and expert feedback

Propose three or more math lesson strategies promoting learner engagement and self-directed discovery (e.g., social constructivist activities, culturally contextualized problem-solving, civic competency enhancement projects)
Collaboratively derive lesson improvement plans with peer teachers, document them via an LMS, and implement relationship-building strategies for forming an educational community
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
